Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= iron framework; ◄ part of an altar or fire place; ► location where objects are burned; ≈ associated with fire
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= causative action by which humans ensure that a fire (אֵשׁ) is provided with sufficient combustible materials to keep it going; ≈ associated with anger
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= a generic word for clothing, which in certain contexts may denote a specific kind of clothes, such as someone's tunic or armor

= woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
= undergarment covering the lower part of the naked body

= woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
= action by which humans put on clothes or ornaments
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person

= remainders of the fat of animals after it has been burned
